titleStmt.title: E. C. Spiceland et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10716

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: Your petitioners will respectfully state to your Excellency will re that at the last term of the Trigg Circuit Court James A Calhoun was fined fifty Dollars for carrying concealed weapons, Calhoun had his witnesses summoned and they did not attend. Nor Neither did Calhoun appear at Court on account the sickness of his wife. When if Calhoun had of been at court and had his witness there he could have proved that he come under one of the exceptions of the statute. We further state to your Excellency that Calhoun is a very poor man and have a large family, We therefore ask your Excellency to Interpose and release said fine

E. C. Spiceland
R M Rogers
C. C. Flora
G. S. Mimms
Thos E Blake
J.. P. Gentry
J. Mcgurie
N. C. Cheatham
Wm Duwitt

Jno R Grace P. J. L C
Will please omit any communication he may have for petitioner to him (James A. Calhoun) Blandsville Ballard Co Ky. & Your petitioner as in duty bound will forever pray &c

Trigg Cir. Ct
$50. } Weapons
Jas A Calhoun
